title: 820-4924 no S4 state
message:
Hello, 
I have this board, water damaged, no power 

PP3V42_G3H    3,4    
PPBUS_G3H    12.59    
PPVRTC_G3H    3,3    
PP5V_S5             5 
PP3V3_S5          3,3    
SMC_RESET_L    3,36    

PM_SLP_S5_L does have a ~3.2V pulse when first hooking power up. the pulse lasts about 20 milliseconds,

I soldered a wire on SMC_ONOFF_L and I touched to the ground
 PM_PWRBTN_L and PM_SLP_S5_L  don't react at the same time.
PM_RSMRST_L is high

title: 820-4924 no S4 state
message:
If you cannot catch a drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L, should be a SMC issue.
As always for water damaged boards, I recommend to start reballing SMC.
Do you get steady high PM_SLP_SUS_L?

title: 820-4924 no S4 state
message:
yes i have PM_SLP_SUS_L

PM_PWRBTN_L drop when SMC_ONOFF_L shorted
SMC replaced no change

title: 820-4924 no S4 state
message:
Check traces and components around SMC.
Also inspect entire board for corrosion.
Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?

title: 820-4924 no S4 state
message:
The board trying to start but it stop, 
normally it consume 0.01A but suddenly it jump to 0.20-0.30A and to come back to 0.2
I can't find  broken traces it is clean

title: 820-4924 no S4 state
message:
"PM_PWRBTN_L and PM_SLP_S5_L don't react at the same time."
That is impossible, if the board tries to start.
You've also said
"PM_SLP_S5_L does have a ~3.2V pulse when first hooking power up"
Does it happen only when connect charger?
No reaction of any PM_SLP_Sx_L signals when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L signal?

title: 820-4924 no S4 state
message:
sorry, I was wrong.
PM_PWRBTN_L react when I short SMC_ONOFF_L
PM_SLP_S5_L get high every ~10 sec for 20ms, but no reaction when I trigger SMC_ONOFF_L

title: 820-4924 no S4 state
message:
Check for pulse at all big coils.
At same time of PM_SLP_S5_L pulse.

title: 820-4924 no S4 state
message: yes, there are pulses on the big coils at the same time PM_SLP_S5_L pulse.

title: 820-4924 no S4 state
message:
Then you have pulses at PM_SLP_S3/0_L too.
VCORE tries to appear?
Also check if all voltages from page 63 pulse; one power rail may be shorted to ground.

"Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?"
???

Any pulse at pins 7 & 3 of U1950?
You can also try a known good BIOS file.

title: 820-4924 no S4 state
message:
002 in diode mode means 4-5 ohms and could be good value for VCORE.

"check if all voltages from page 63 pulse; one power rail may be shorted to ground."
???

Pay atention to 5V filter caps for audio...

title: 820-4924 no S4 state
message:
PPVCC_S0_CPU 0.3ohms
on page 63 all signals are pulsing and nothing shorted to froung

"Pay atention to 5V filter caps for audio..." where is this cap, sorry i am still learning

title: 820-4924 no S4 state
message: Look at schematic, audio area and there should be some 4.5-5v rails; C6412/22/32/42...
